HPI 8286 Lancia 037 Evo 1984 1000 Lakes Rally 3rd Place H. Toivonen/J. Piironen



For the 1984 WRC season team Audi put together four of the top rally drivers in the world: defending world champion Hannu Mikkola, Stig Blomqvist, Michéle Mouton, and (from Lanica) Walter Röhrl. Not to be outdone, Lancia team boss Cesare Fiorio signed Henri Toivonen from Porsche to join Markku Alén, Miki Biasion, and Attilio Bettega.

Toivonen and Juha Piironen were scheduled to compete in 5 WRC events for the 1984 season in addition to driving for Porsche in the European Rally Championship (ERC). Toivonen’s debut with Lancia was the Rallye de Portugal where he crashed out on stage 5. Two months later, in the Acropolis Rally, he crashed out again on stage 23. His third event was his home event, the 1000 Lakes Rally. He fared much better in this event, picking up 7 stage wins and finishing in 3rd place overall.

This would be his best result of the season as a back injury forced him to miss Rallye Sanremo and the RAC Rally.
